intro: Scurrula belvisii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Scurrula belvisii is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh environments.
